definitions: a solemn utterance intended to invoke a supernatural power to inflict harm or punishment on someone or something
meaning.examples: she'd put a curse on him
subsense: a cause of harm or misery

definitions: a feeling of deep admiration for someone or something elicited by their abilities, qualities, or achievements
meaning.examples: the director had a lot of respect for Douglas as an actor
shortDefinitions: feeling of deep admiration for person or thing elicited by their abilities or achievements
subsense: the state of being admired or respected

definitions: a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used with others (or sometimes alone) to form a sentence and typically shown with a space on either side when written or printed
shortDefinitions: single meaningful element of speech or writing
subsense: a single distinct conceptual unit of language, comprising inflected and variant forms.

definitions: produced, introduced, or discovered recently or now for the first time; not existing before
